title: Maro Itoje rises to the occasion to break the All Blacks' will with one of the great second row performances
text:
The English celebrations in the stands were just starting to subside at the Yokohama International Stadium as Steve Hansen strode across the pitch. Having addressed his own players, the New Zealand head coach made a beeline for Maro Itoje to shake the hand of the man who had crushed the All Blacks’ aura. As much as he was hurting, Hansen still found the time to salute greatness.

The greatest ever performance by an England second row? Martin Johnson in the 2003 World Cup final or a few months earlier in Wellington. Simon Shaw for the Lions in the second Test of the 2009 series South Africa are contenders. This might just have surpassed those heady heights.
